documentation.title: Function Comment
documentation.standard:
Non-void returning functions must have a @return docblock tag.
This rule enforces:
1. Functions with non-void return types (string, bool, etc.) must have a `@return` tag. 2. Functions with void return types must NOT have `@return` tags, except generator functions. 3. Generator functions must have a `@return` tag with type iterable.
Notes:
- Both typed and untyped functions are checked. - Return types can be declared or inferred from function signature. - Magic methods (e.g. __construct, __get, etc.) are exempt from requiring @return tags. - Fixing `@return` tags will have the type `mixed`, and generator functions will have the type `iterable`; these should then be edited manually to specific types.
